Departing thence, we carne to a lodge at a certain Arab fortress. Thereupon, the lord of the place came out and made an agreement with the Count. On the third day we went forth from the city and, passing over a high and immense mountain, entered the valley of Desem, in which there was the- greatest abundance of all goods, and we were there for about fifteen days.
